result.execSummary:
The defendant Lenzie T Junior was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child (<16 Years Of Age), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
No contact with SR, dob 9-18-97, unless authorized by agent.

Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Register as a sex offender.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Perform 60 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lenzie T Junior in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 38 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 14 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS.  
The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 30 MONTHS. 
Conditions of probation include:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA and other counseling needs to be determined; random urine screens.
-Maintain full-time employment.
-Perform 60 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
-No contact with SR, dob 9-18-97, unless authorized by agent.
-Register as a sex offender.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he  may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is to be advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant Lenzie T Junior in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
AMENDED INFORMATION filed by the state:  SECOND DEGREE SEXUAL ASSAULT OF A CHILD (<16 years of age), a class C felony, 948.02(2).  Defense acknowledged receipt, waived reading.
To the amended charge:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Case is adjourned to 8-5-2014 at 8:15 for sentencing.

Defendant Lenzie T Junior in court with attorney Scott F. Anderson.  Joshua M. Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has filed a motion to adjourn the jury trial set for today due to another trial proceeding in another court.  The Court is advised that parties are close to a resolution and requesting a plea date next week.  Case is adjourned to 7-24-2014 at 8:15 for plea.
to Adjourn Jury Trial of 7-16-2014 filed by defense.
Final pretrial conference held.  Case remains calendared on 07/16/2014 for jury trial in Branch 38.  State withdrew their offer.

Defendant Lenzie T Junior in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  Charges were not amended, however the date of Count 1 was changed.

Defendant Lenzie T Junior in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises that the Court that the case has not resolved yet and requests another final pretrial.  The State will revoke its offer on the next date of 6-30-2014.

Defendant Lenzie T Junior in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are still negotiating possible resolution.    Case set for final pretrial on 6-12-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 7-16-2014 at 8:15am. 
Defense is moving modify the NO CONTACT ORDER to which the state is opposed.  Victim is not present on today's date.  The Court will deny the motion, however, defense may raise it at another time and have the victim present.

Defendant Lenzie T Junior in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is withdrawing motion for modification of bail filed 4-24-2014.
Defense received offer from State today and is requesting time to review with defendant.
Case is set for pretrial on 5-8-2014 at 8:15.
for Bail Modification filed by defense.

Defendant Lenzie T Junior in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Thomas Potter for Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 25, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-21-2014 at 08:30 am.

  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch *38.
